org.efaps.db.databases

Class OracleDatabaseWithAutoSequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.efaps.db.databases.AbstractDatabase<OracleDatabase>
      • org.efaps.db.databases.OracleDatabase
        • org.efaps.db.databases.OracleDatabaseWithAutoSequence

  • public class OracleDatabaseWithAutoSequence
extends OracleDatabase
    The database driver is used for Oracle databases starting with version 9i. The difference to OracleDatabase is, that this class supports auto generated keys.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    The eFaps Team

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected(Connection _connection)
                    throws SQLException
        Method is used to determine if this DataBase is connected. It uses SQL statements against the database to determine if it is the right database using unique identifiers e.g. systemtables, version info etc.
        Overrides:
        isConnected in class OracleDatabase
        Parameters:
        _connection - Connection to be used foo analyze
        Returns:
        true if this database is connected
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • defineTableAutoIncrement

        public OracleDatabase defineTableAutoIncrement(Connection _con,
                                      String _table)
                                        throws SQLException
        For the database from vendor Oracle, an eFaps SQL table with auto increment is created in this steps:
        • SQL table itself with column ID and unique key on the column is created
        • sequence with same name of table and suffix _SEQ is created
        • trigger with same name of table and suffix _TRG is created. The trigger sets automatically the column ID with the next value of the sequence
        An eFaps SQL table without auto increment, but with parent table is created in this steps:
        • SQL table itself with column ID and unique key on the column is created
        • the foreign key to the parent table is automatically set
        The creation of the table itself is done by calling the inherited method OracleDatabase.createTable(java.sql.Connection, java.lang.String) Defines a new created SQL table as auto incremented.
        Overrides:
        defineTableAutoIncrement in class OracleDatabase
        Parameters:
        _con - SQL connection
        _table - name of the SQL table to update
        Returns:
        this instance
        Throws:
        SQLException - if the update of the table failed

      • supportsGetGeneratedKeys

        public boolean supportsGetGeneratedKeys()
        This implementation of the vendor specific database driver implements the auto generated keys. So always true is returned.
        Overrides:
        supportsGetGeneratedKeys in class AbstractDatabase<OracleDatabase>
        Returns:
        always true because supported by Oracle database

      • supportsMultiGeneratedKeys

        public boolean supportsMultiGeneratedKeys()
        Description copied from class: AbstractDatabase
        The method returns if a database implementation support to get multiple auto generated keys. If defined to true, the insert is done with defined column names for the auto generated columns. Otherwise only Statement.RETURN_GENERATED_KEYS is given for the insert.
        Overrides:
        supportsMultiGeneratedKeys in class AbstractDatabase<OracleDatabase>
        Returns:
        always true because supported by Oracle database
        See Also:
        AbstractDatabase.supportsGetGeneratedKeys()

      • getNewId

        public long getNewId(Connection _con,
            String _table,
            String _column)
              throws SQLException
        This method normally returns for given table and column a new id. Because this database driver support auto generated keys, an SQL exception is always thrown.
        Overrides:
        getNewId in class OracleDatabase
        Parameters:
        _con - sql connection
        _table - sql table for which a new id must returned
        _column - sql table column for which a new id must returned
        Returns:
        nothing, because SQLException is always thrown
        Throws:
        SQLException - always, because this database driver supports auto generating keys
